docs.summary: An accordion item displayed within an [accordion]($w.Accordion.html) element.
description: > This feature is currently only available in Editor X.
Each accordion element contains multiple accordion items.
One or multiple accordion items can be displayed concurrently according to settings.
The site visitor can navigate between accordion items without leaving the page
by clicking a title.
![accordion item Example](images/accordion.png "Accordion Item Example")

docs.summary: Indicates if an accordion item is collapsed.
description: If collapsed is `true`, the accordion item is not displayed on the page under any circumstances.
However, the collapsed accordion item is still in the site's DOM.
Unlike a `hidden` element, a collapsed element doesn't take up any space on the page.
To set the collapsed property on an accordion item, use the accordion item's `collapse()` and `expand()` functions.

examples.title: Get whether an accordion item is collapsed

docs.summary: Sets or gets the accordion item's label.
description: The label of the accordion item appears in the accordion item's title. It is limited to 120 characters.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the accordion item's `collapsed` property has been set to `true`.

description: When you collapse an accordion item, this collapses only the content and
the title remains displayed.
The `collapse()` function returns a Promise that is resolved when the
accordion item's [`collapsed`](#collapsed) property has been set to `true`.
You can also collapse an accordion item
when the page loads by using the Properties and Events panel in the Editor.
>**Note:** The `collapse()` function doesn't remove elements from the DOM.

examples.title: Toggle an accordion item's collapsed state

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the accordion item's `collapsed` property has been set to `false`.

description: When you expand an accordion item, this expands the accordion item content under
the accordion item's title.
The `expand()` function returns a Promise that is resolved when the
accordion item's [`collapsed`](#collapsed) property has been set to `false`
